inflate.translation[0].definitions[0].de: to fill something with air or gas so it becomes larger, or to become filled with air or gas
inflate.translation[0].definitions[0].ex: It took us half an hour to inflate the dinghy.
Her life jacket failed to inflate.
inflate.translation[0].definitions[1].de: to make something seem more important or impressive than it really is
inflate.translation[0].definitions[1].ex: The success further inflated his self-confidence.
The numbers of people involved have been grossly inflated by the media.
inflate.translation[0].definitions[2].de: to increase in price, or to make something increase in price
inflate.translation[0].definitions[2].ex: Hotels often inflate prices at particular times of the year.
inflate.translation[1].definitions[0].de: if the cost or level of something inflates or is inflated, it increases, often above what is reasonable or normal
inflate.translation[1].definitions[0].ex: Overseas sales were inflated by the depreciation of the yen.
Costs of bringing crops to market are likely to inflate due to the high price of oil.
